episode.content: Runners have 72 hours to complete a 400-km "Survival Run" around the main island of Okinawa Prefecture, southern Japan. The 68 participants from across Japan complain that the race is exhausting and torturous, yet they continue to push themselves, day and night. Some say that running allows them to forget all their worries and stress, others say they enjoy increasing their distance. We spent 3 days chasing after them to find out what motivates them to continue running.
episode.description: In a 400K race in Okinawa Pref., participants keep running day and night to finish within the 72-hour time limit. We chased after them to find out why they push themselves to the brink of exhaustion.
episode.subtitle: A 400K "Survival Run" in Okinawa
episode.title: Document 72 Hours

episode.content: A store in Akihabara, Japan's biggest electronics town, sells over 100,000 electronics parts, including resistors, capacitors and circuit boards. Around 1,000 people come to the store every day, from professional engineers to people who like to build their own electronics for fun. Among the people we meet are a musician who makes his own effects units; a graduate student who makes drones to take a break from job hunting; and a man whose hobby of fixing car audio systems has turned into a job. For 3 days, we peeked inside the store to find out what it is people come to buy and what they hope to create with it.
episode.description: In Akihabara, Japan's biggest electronics town, one store is famous for the wide range of electronics parts they carry - over 100,000 of them. What do people buy and what do they hope to make with it?
episode.subtitle: Akihabara: Infatuated with Electronics
episode.title: Document 72 Hours

episode.content: In this episode, the stage is a low-budget wedding hall in Tokyo, where 30-40 couples shuffle through every day for affordable, small-scale, short notice wedding arrangements. For many of the couples, the simple weddings are a display of best effort in the face of the demands of work and family. Some skip the ceremony altogether, opting to just have pictures taken to commemorate a turning point in their lives. For all the couples, the weddings represent a profound triumph over adversity, and celebration of a new life together. People from all walks of life, and their small wedding stories.
episode.description: A wedding hall in Tokyo offers affordable, small-scale ceremonies. People from all walks of life shuffle through every day for a consultation. We asked them about their small wedding story.
episode.subtitle: Small Wedding Stories
episode.title: Document 72 Hours

episode.content: A road near Tokyo's Roppongi district is an oasis for taxi drivers who are allowed to park here for as long as they like. There, the drivers can relax, eat and even sleep on a break. As the coronavirus pandemic rumbles on, how do drivers feel about their jobs? The drivers we met included one who started this career after the pandemic erupted, one thinking of quitting because his income has plunged and another who cannot quit because he has a family to support. For 3 days, we asked drivers who parked along this road about their job and what the future holds.
episode.description: How has the coronavirus pandemic hit taxi drivers? What are they thinking as they drive the streets of Tokyo? For 3 days, we spoke to drivers relaxing along a street, which they call their "oasis."
episode.subtitle: Tokyo Taxi Oasis
episode.title: Document 72 Hours
